articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Greetings to Russian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Greetings to Russian President
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, president of the Russian Federation, on Friday.
					 Kim Jong Un in his message extended warm congratulations and salute to the Russian president and, through him, to the people of the Russian Federation on its national day.
					
					 Kim Jong Un noted in his message that Russia has achieved great successes and progress in all fields including socio-political life, economy and national defence, firmly protecting the dignity and interests of the country under the leadership of the president.
					
					 Noting with pleasure that the DPRK-Russia friendly relations with a long history and tradition have successfully developed in the spirit of the joint documents adopted at the top-level talks in the new century, Kim Jong Un expressed conviction that the bilateral relations would develop on a higher stage this year, the year of friendship.
					
					 He wished the Russian president good health and big success in his responsible work for the wellbeing of the Russian people.

articles.title: Congratulations to British Queen
articles.content:
Congratulations to British Queen
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a congratulatory message to British Queen Elizabeth II on June 1 on the occasion of her official birthday, the national day of the UK.
					 Expressing belief that the relations between the DPRK and UK would grow stronger, the message wished the queen good health and happiness.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Philippines
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Philippines 
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Benigno Simeon Cojuangco Aquino, president of the Republic of the Philippines, on Friday to mark the 117th anniversary of its independence. 
					 The message wished the president of the Philippines success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Philippine FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Philippine FM
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong Friday sent a message of greeting to his counterpart Albert F. del Rosario on the occasion of the 117th anniversary of the independence of Philippines.
					 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields.

articles.title: Message of Condolence to C.C., People's Party of Cambodia
articles.content:
Message of Condolence to C.C., People's Party of Cambodia
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Thursday sent a message of condolence to the Central Committee of the People's Party of Cambodia in connection with the fact that Chairman of the party Prince Chea Sim died of illness.
					 The message expressed deep condolences to the C.C., the People's Party of Cambodia and the bereaved families.
					
					 The prince made great contributions to the prosperity of Cambodia and national unity and the development of friendly relations between the DPRK and Cambodia, the message said, adding that his feats will be deeply kept in the minds of the Cambodian people.

articles.title: DPRK Weightlifters Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Weightlifters Back Home
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- DPRK weightlifters returned home on Friday after participating in the 2015 World Youth Weightlifting Championship held in Poland.
					 The championship brought together at least 230 men and women players from over 40 countries and regions including the DPRK, Uzbekistan and Turkey.
					
					 DPRK weightlifter Pak Jong Ju came first in the separate events and total points in the men's 62 kg category by lifting 124 kg in snatch and 156 kg in jerk. He proved successful in the 2013 World Juvenile Weightlifting Championships and the 2nd Juvenile Olympic Games.
					
					 Kwon Yong Gwang finished third in snatch and jerk and total points in the men's 69 kg category and Ri Song Gum in the women's 48 kg category while Rim Un Sim third in snatch and total points in the women's 58 kg category.

articles.title: Russian Embassy Officials Visit Liberation Tower, Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of Soviet Army
articles.content:
Russian Embassy Officials Visit Liberation Tower, Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of Soviet Army
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the Russian embassy here laid a wreath before the Liberation Tower on Friday to mark the national day of Russia.
					Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Alexandr Matsegora, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy.
					
					After a wreath was laid in the name of the Russian embassy, the participants paid silent tribute to the fallen fighters of the Soviet Army.
					
					Staff members of the Russian embassy also laid a wreath, bouquets and flowers before the cemetery of fallen fighters of the Soviet Army in Sadong District, Pyongyang. 
					
					Meanwhile, members of the Russian consulate general in Chongjin City laid bouquets before the Liberation Tower and cemetery of fallen fighters of the Soviet Army in the city on the same day.

articles.title: DPRK Beats Yemen in World Cup Qualifier
articles.content:
DPRK Beats Yemen in World Cup Qualifier
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The second-round Asian qualifiers began for the 2018 FIFA World Cup.
					 The DPRK, belonging to group H with Bahrain, Uzbekistan, Yemen and Philippines, defeated Yemen 1:0 in the first match in Qatar on June 11.
					
					 The chief coach of the DPRK team is Kim Chang Bok and its mainstay footballers include Ri Myong Guk, Pak Kwang Ryong and Ri Yong Jik, who were active in the 17th Asian Games.
					
					 The DPRK will play the second match with Uzbekistan in Pyongyang on June 16.

articles.title: DPRK Players Prove Successful at 2015 Asian Junior Wrestling Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Players Prove Successful at 2015 Asian Junior Wrestling Championship
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- DPRK players Jo Hyok Chol and Mun Su Jong bagged gold medals at the 2015 Asian Junior Wrestling Championship which started in India on June 11.
					 The championship brought together more than 290 men and women players from over 20 countries and regions including the DPRK.
					
					 At the 42kg men's Greco-Roman category, Jo Hyok Chol defeated his Japanese rival in the preliminaries, Turkmen rival in the quarter finals, Kazakh rival in the semifinals and Iranian rival in the finals. 
					
					 Mun Su Jong defeated her Kazakh and Taipei of China rivals at the 40kg women's category and trounced her Indian rival at the finals.

articles.title: Won Un Gyong, World Boxing Champion
articles.content:
Won Un Gyong, World Boxing Champion
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Won Un Gyong of the DPRK bagged a gold medal at the 2015 world juvenile and youth women's boxing championship held some days ago.
					 Won defeated her Turkish rival 3:0 in the finals of the juvenile 46kg category after beating back Russian rival by 2:1 in the semi-finals and overwhelming Mongolian and Swiss rivals by 3:0 in the preliminary and quarterfinals respectively.
					
					 Kim Jong Chol, deputy secretary of the DPRK Boxing Association, said it was the first time for Won to take part in the international game.
					
					  She war born into a worker's family and began boxing at her age of 10.
					
					 She won gold medals at the national games of juvenile sports schools and junior championships held last year.

articles.title: Anti-Japanese Youth Hero of Korea
articles.content:
Anti-Japanese Youth Hero of Korea
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Today marks the 99th birth anniversary of Kim Chol Ju, an indomitable revolutionary fighter of Korea.
					 Kim Chol Ju embarked on the road of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle in his teens and had heroically fought for the liberation of Korea and its people's freedom and happiness.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung stressed the need for youngsters to join efforts in the struggle for national liberation and, in hearty response to this call, Kim Chol Ju became a core member of the Saenal Children's Union, the first revolutionary organization of children in Korea.
					
					 Kim Chol Ju worked heart and soul for Korea-China allied front against the Japanese, a strategic line set forth by the President. He conducted his energetic activities among Chinese anti-Japanese nationalist units to foil the Japanese imperialists' cunning moves against the allied front.
					
					 He also displayed his distinguished disposition as a military strategist and bravery in many battles with the enemies.
					
					 True to Kim Il Sung's line of anti-Japanese national united front, he conducted enlightenment activities among workers, peasants, intellectuals and businessmen and even landowners in Antu area to rally them around the banner of anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.
					
					 On June 14, Juche 24 (1935) when he was 19 years-old, Kim Chol Ju died a heroic death in a battle with the enemies in the area of Chechangzi.
					
					 He showed in practice how devotedly revolutionaries should defend their leader.

articles.title: Sci-Tech Achievements for Coal Production Made in DPRK
articles.content:
Sci-Tech Achievements for Coal Production Made in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK has made a lot of sci-tech achievements helpful to coal output.
					 The Sunchon Area Anthracite-mining Engineering Institute of the Coal Science Branch enhanced the gear efficiency of inertia-type loader and conveying equipment, raising the coal mining rate more 20 to 30 percent than before.
					
					 The Research Institute of Mining Machinery and the Coal-mining Engineering Institute of the Coal Science Branch developed new high-performance puncher, crosscut saw and other machines needed for drilling work. And they invented a new manual mortar filling machine and a device for controlling speed of electric car.
					
					 The Central Mining Research Institute helped lengthen the serviceable life of tub wheel bearing and establish an air-tight tub wheel production process at coal mines.
					
					 The Geological Institute developed a precision CT prospecting apparatus. 
					
					 The Environmental Engineering Institute succeeded in modeling the whole tunnels of coal mine to ensure the scientific accuracy of mining process design.
					
					 Manufactory No. 111 developed a three-phase electric monitor device and established an image and voice communication system.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Snubs U.S. Hypocritical Talk about Dialogue
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Snubs U.S. Hypocritical Talk about Dialogue
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Department of State recently urged the DPRK to stop making "provocations" and take a meaningful measure for denuclearization, asserting the resumption of the six-party talks entirely depends on the latter.
					 Earlier, the U.S., at a consultative meeting with Japan and the south Korean puppet group, falsified the truth, giving impression that the DPRK has refused to have dialogue with them although they have wanted to do so.
					
					 This is no more than a crafty gimmick of Washington to deceive the world public through its stereo-typed trumpeting about "dialogue" and step up its preparations for a new war in the Asia-Pacific.
					
					 It is well known to everybody that the DPRK has long called for resuming dialogue without any precondition and made sincere efforts to do so but the U.S. has blocked it by raising various unjust "preconditions."
					
					 When the DPRK clarified its stand to defuse the danger of a war and ease tension on the Korean peninsula and, to this end, proposed a moratorium on its nuclear test in return for the U.S. temporary cessation of its joint military drills with south Korea, the U.S. turned down even the former's offer of dialogue concerning the proposal but responded to it with saber-rattling. 
					
					 The U.S. has staged a series of military drills against the DPRK in league with the south Korean puppet forces.
					
					 The U.S. imperialist aggressor forces and the south Korean puppet navy staged joint strike drills with various type artillery pieces, warships and fighters involved and test-fired ballistic missiles, while going busy with anti-submarine rehearsals in the waters east of Jeju Island from May 30 to June 3. 
					
					The U.S. has continued shipping latest war hardware into south Korea and formed a new joint division with south Korean puppet forces.
					
					 In the " strategic outline" jointly released by the U.S. forces command in south Korea, the U.S.-south Korea joint command and the "UN Command" on June 2, the U.S. clarified that it would deploy 60 percent of its naval forces in the Asia-Pacific and the Indian Ocean, the bulk of which is expected to be deployed in south Korea, pursuant to its "rebalancing strategy for Asia-Pacific." Among the latest war hardware to be deployed in south Korea are EA-18, DDG-1 000 stealth destroyer, LCS coastal warship, MV-22s, P-8 patrol planes and Aegis destroyers for intercepting ballistic missiles.
					
					 The above-said joint division, the first of its kind in the world, is to play the role of a flagship and shock brigade for the U.S. nuclear war. Its mission is to carry out a special task for making a preemptive strike at the nuclear and missile bases of the DPRK after infiltrating into it all of a sudden.
					
					 All facts go to clearly prove that the U.S. is just the aggressor and provocateur harassing peace and stability on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia to bring dark clouds of a nuclear war to hang over there.
					
					 In the final analysis, the "threat from nukes and missiles from the north" much touted by the U.S. and the south Korean puppet regime has only brought to light their scenario to attain such a sinister design as to finally round off their preparations for a nuclear war by bringing means for a nuclear preemptive strike to south Korea and make such strikes at the DPRK and its neighboring countries any moment.
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that the Russian Foreign Ministry asserted that the resumption of the six-party talks and diplomatic settlement are possible only through the defusing of the tense military and political situation on the Korean peninsula and in its vicinity.
					
					 The U.S. can never evade its responsibility for scuppering the opportunity for denuclearization on the Korean peninsula and escalating tension there.

articles.title: S. Koreans Protest against THAAD Deployment
articles.content:
S. Koreans Protest against THAAD Deployment
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea launched actions in Seoul, Kwangju, Taegu and other places on June 9 in protest against the U.S. deployment of THAAD.
					 Asserting the U.S. THAAD is targeting the whole of Northeast Asia, the organization disclosed the injustice and danger of its deployment in south Korea.
					
					 This being a hard reality, the U.S. is misleading the public opinion after conducting a survey for the site for its deployment, it charged.
					
					 It blamed the Foreign Ministry and Defense Ministry of south Korea for keeping mum about the U.S. move.
					
					 It declared that it would make every possible effort to hold in check the deployment.

articles.title: Hunger Strike Staged in Protest against Clampdown on Trade Union
articles.content:
Hunger Strike Staged in Protest against Clampdown on Trade Union 
						
  Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The Metal Trade Union of south Korea staged a hunger strike in protest against big businesses' clampdown on the union in Seoul on June 9, according to south Korean paper Nodong and Segye.
					  Prior to the strike, it held a press conference.
					
					 Speakers recalled that the chief of a sub-branch of a branch of the Kwangju-South Jolla Provincial Chapter of the trade union committed suicide in protest against the clampdown on the union and human rights abuse while working at a business managed by Park Ji Man, brother of the chief executive.
					
					  They demanded Park Ji Man immediately come out for negotiations with the trade union, own responsibility for the death and make an apology for it, not going at large under the patronage of the chief executive.
					
					  They declared they would stage actions for the resignation of Park Ji Man and the Park regime unless the situation is settled.
					
					 Then, the son of the deceased and trade unionists entered a hunger strike after having their heads shaven.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Guinean Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Guinean Organization
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- A Guinean preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and the liberation of Korea issued a bulletin on June 4 on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the WPK.
					 The bulletin said in an article titled "Kim Jong Il, immortal exploits in party building" that while leading the WPK, he set it as the most important task to develop the party into the one of President Kim Il Sung, the founder of the party, both in name and reality and successfully carried it out. It went on:
					
					 He set the Juche idea, the revolutionary idea of the President, as the only guiding idea of the WPK and proclaimed it as the supreme programme of the party to model the whole society on the Juche idea.
					
					 He built the WPK into the party which has formed a harmonious whole with the popular masses and taken care of them in a responsible manner while serving them faithfully.
					
					 He developed the party into the powerful guiding force of the revolutionary cause of Songun.
					
					 The exploits he performed in party building will shine long.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Party Leadership Exploits Praised by Russian Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Party Leadership Exploits Praised by Russian Papers
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- Russian papers dedicated one whole page apiece to the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 They carried photos of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il standing together, those of Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un standing together, portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and their pictures.
					
					 Byvor on June 5 in an article titled "Kim Jong Il, immortal exploits in party building" praised him for developing the WPK into the party of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It said that Kim Jong Il built the WPK into the party which has formed a harmonious whole with the popular masses and taken care of them in a responsible manner and a powerful political force successfully steering the revolutionary cause of Songun, adding that the feats he performed in party building will shine long with socialist Korea winning only victories.
					
					 The June 3-9 issue of Pravda Primoriya in an article titled "Eternal general secretary of WPK" noted that he wisely led the WPK and the revolution to victory with his extraordinary political caliber, outstanding leadership art and popular style of work.
					
					 Nakhodkinski Rabochi on June 2 in an article titled "Socialism of Korea" said that the DPRK will shed its brighter rays as an invincible socialist power.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Iran
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Iran
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- An Iranian preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and the liberation of Korea was formed in Teheran on June 7.
					 The chairman of the Al Hadi Islam Propaganda Organization of Iran was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 It decided to organize colorful political and cultural events on the occasion of the anniversaries.

articles.title: Swiss Bodies Protest against U.S. Scenario for Germ Warfare on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Swiss Bodies Protest against U.S. Scenario for Germ Warfare on Korean Peninsula
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement on June 4 in protest against the U.S. imperialists' moves to plunge the Korean nation into a horrible disaster of germ warfare.
					 Recalling it was recently disclosed that the U.S. has introduced anthrax germs into south Korea and stored them there, the statement said that it brought to light the true colors of the U.S. as the chief culprit of massacres who makes no scruple of perpetrating monstrous acts and crimes against humankind.
					
					 The International Criminal Court should sternly punish the U.S. president, the U.S. secretary of Defense and the commander of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces present in south Korea, the arch criminals, and the south Korean authorities following the U.S. scenario.
					
					 The U.S. criminal scenario proves that it is scheming to use such inhuman weapons for a war against the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK will never allow the U.S. to reduce the Korean peninsula to ruins with bio-chemical warfare.

articles.title: UK Organizations Accuse U.S. of Introducing Anthrax Germs into S. Korea
articles.content:
UK Organizations Accuse U.S. of Introducing Anthrax Germs into S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Korean Friendship Association UK released a joint statement on June 6 denouncing the U.S. forces present in south Korea for introducing anthrax germs there.
					 The statement said that as was proven by the recently disclosed fact that the U.S. forces present in south Korea introduced in secrecy active anthrax germs into their military base, the U.S. imperialists are actually stepping up the preparations for a bio-chemical warfare on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 A spokesman for the DPRK Measure Council for Human Rights in South Korea in a statement said that the U.S. imperialists have long been engaged in their criminal moves to make the Korean nation victims of their bio-chemical warfare, it noted, and went on: Their bestial nature to exterminate all Koreans had already been brought to light as they committed a germ warfare during the past Korean war and turned south Korea into a test ground of germ weapons and a living-body test base in the post-war period. 
					
					 Although the U.S. imperialists' scenario to exterminate all Koreans has been fully disclosed, the Park Geun Hye fascist puppet group is shielding the serious criminal act of the U.S. forces present in south Korea.
					
					 Park should be indicted and judged at the International Criminal Court at once for her crimes against humanity as she is a war criminal just like the U.S. imperialists.

articles.title: Anti-U.S. Meeting Held in Germany
articles.content:
Anti-U.S. Meeting Held in Germany
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- An anti-U.S. meeting was held by the Franken Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Germany on June 5 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The chief of the group and other speakers said that the U.S. and its followers are leaving no means untried to stifle the anti-imperialist independent countries.
					
					 The U.S. is regarding the DPRK, a powerful nuclear weapons state, as a thorn in its flesh, they said, adding that the U.S. and its lackeys are applying useless sanctions and escalating "human rights" racket against the DPRK but dare not provoke it equipped with powerful nuclear deterrent.
					
					 They said the reality of the DPRK helped them know that it is imperative to have one's own strong force in order to protect one's country. They expressed their will to make all members of the group have a correct understanding of the DPRK and fully support the just cause of the Korean people.

articles.title: Venezuelan Politician Hopes for Boosting Friendly and Cooperative Relations with WPK
articles.content:
Venezuelan Politician Hopes for Boosting Friendly and Cooperative Relations with WPK
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- DPRK Ambassador to Venezuela Ri Sung Gil paid a courtesy call on Oscar Figuera, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Venezuela, on May 22.
					 The general secretary said that President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il were the great leaders who devoted all their lives to the freedom and happiness of the Korean people and the development of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), turned the DPRK into the invincible socialist power and made contributions to achieving the global peace and accomplishing the human cause of independence. 
					
					 As led by Marshal Kim Jong Un, the WPK is growing stronger and dynamically demonstrating its dignity as the revolutionary party, he noted, adding:
					
					 The miracles of the DPRK under the leadership of the WPK are greatly encouraging the members of the Communist Party of Venezuela struggling for socialism.
					
					 The WPK has played a leading role in the struggle to defend peace and security on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of the world and advance the socialist cause.
					
					 The relations between the two parties, governments and peoples have been steadily strengthened in the joint struggle to meet all challenges of the imperialists and build socialism.
					
					 The Communist Party of Venezuela will as ever extend support and solidarity to the policies enforced by the WPK and the cause of Korea's reunification.
					
					 The party will make positive efforts to boost the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties.

articles.title: Solidarity with Korean People's Struggle for National Reunification Expressed at International Meeting
articles.content:
Solidarity with Korean People's Struggle for National Reunification Expressed at International Meeting
						
  Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- A solidarity resolution for Korea's reunification was adopted at the meeting of the Presidential Council of the World Federation of Trade Unions (WFTU) held in Geneva on June 7.
					  The resolution said that this year marks the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					  Since the U.S. occupied south Korea after Japan's defeat, the U.S. has inflicted the sufferings of division upon the Korean nation through constant war threats and moves for harassing peace, it said, and went on:
					
					  Today the situation on the Korean peninsula is so tense that a war may break out anytime due to the U.S. and the south Korean authorities' reckless hostile policy towards the DPRK and their war exercises.
					
					  Asserting that to realize the independent reunification of Korea is the unanimous desire of not only the Korean people but also the world progressives and peace-loving forces and the requirement of the times, the WFTU resolves as follows:
					
					  Firstly, the WFTU strongly demands the U.S. roll back its hostile policy towards the DPRK, withdraw GIs and nuclear war means from south Korea, stop military exercises for aggression and establish a durable peace mechanism.
					
					 Secondly, the WFTU urges the south Korean authorities to respect the north-south joint declarations, and not to hinder the south Korean trade unions including the Confederation of Trade Unions from achieving solidarity and alliance with the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea.
					
					 Thirdly, the WFTU appeals the world progressives and working people's organizations opposing a war and loving peace to extend support and solidarity to the just struggle of the working people in the north and the south for paving a wide avenue to the independent reunification this year marking the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.

articles.title: British Organization Condemns S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
articles.content:
British Organization Condemns S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The Korean Friendship Association UK posted on its website on May 24 articles disclosing the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket and scandals by the south Korean puppet regime.
					 An article said that the present south Korean chief executive and the coteries of the "Saenuri Party" are busy setting up the UN "office for human rights in north" in Seoul within June and passing the "bill on human rights in the north" at the "National Assembly".
					
					 Disclosing the reactionary nature of the "bill", the article went on:
					
					 There is no human rights issue in the Korean socialist system in which the popular masses are exercising their political freedom and rights and leading an independent life as masters of the society.
					
					 It is nonsensical and ridiculous for the special-class human rights abusers to talk about "human rights" of someone tough they have totally violated the elementary democratic rights of the people through unprecedented dictatorial rule and turned south Korea into the world's worst human rights tundra and the ruins of dire destitution.
					
					 Another article noted that the puppet conservative group keen on fascist dictatorship and treachery after taking power through frauds and swindles and election rigging is driven into tight-corner due to the Song Wan Jong case, a hideous scandal.

articles.title: Swiss Organizations Accuse S. Korean Regime of Its Missile Launch
articles.content:
Swiss Organizations Accuse S. Korean Regime of Its Missile Launch
						
 Pyongyang, June 12 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on June 5 in support of the statement of a spokesman for the Strategic Force of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The joint statement said:
					
					 A spokesman for the KPA Strategic Force in a statement warned the pro-U.S. Park Geun Hye group of traitors in south Korea of its missile launch for aggression.
					
					 It is very just for the DPRK to bolster up capabilities for self-defense to protect its sovereignty.
					
					 The nuclear deterrence and powerful strategic rockets of the DPRK are not aimed at threatening the fellow countrymen in the south.
					
					 The self-defensive means of the KPA are targeting the U.S. imperialists and their puppet Park Geun Hye group.
					
					 In fear of the invincible might of the KPA the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces dare not provoke the second Korean war.
					
					 If they are so foolish as to attempt at a war, they will perish in the sea of flames. They should clearly know about this.
					
					 We vehemently denounce the Park Geun Hye group's provocative missile launch for aggression and fully support the just stand of the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion a Elizabeth II
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion a Elizabeth II
						
Pyongyang, 12 de junio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia primero un mensaje de felicitacion a la reina de Gran Bretana e Irlanda del Norte, Elizabeth II, con motivo del dia conmemorativo oficial de su cumpleanos, Dia Nacional de este pais europeo.
					En la misiva Kim expreso la conviccion de que las relaciones entre Corea y Gran Bretana se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas en el futuro y formulo votos por la salud y la felicidad de la reina.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a presidente filipino
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a presidente filipino
						
Pyongyang, 12 de junio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 12 un mensaje de felicitacion a Simeon Cojuangco Aquino, presidente de la Republica de Filipinas, con motivo del 117o aniversario de la independencia de este pais.
					El remitente le desea al destinatario votos en su trabajo para el desarrollo y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: PTC expresa condolencias por fallecimiento de Chea Sim
articles.content:
PTC expresa condolencias por fallecimiento de Chea Sim
						
Pyongyang, 12 de junio (ACNC) -- El Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea envio el dia 11 un mensaje de condolencias al CC del Partido del Pueblo de Camboya en relacion con que el presidente del CC del PPC, Chea Sim fallecio a causa de una enfermedad.
					La misiva expresa profundas condolencias al CC del PPC y a los familiares del difunto.
					
					Senala que Chea Sim hizo gran aporte a la prosperidad y la unidad nacional de Camboya y al desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises y apunta que sus hazanas quedaran para siempre en el corazon del pueblo camboyano.

articles.title: Luchadores de RPDC ganan medallas de oro en campeonato asiatico de juniores
articles.content:
Luchadores de RPDC ganan medallas de oro en campeonato asiatico de juniores
						
Pyongyang, 12 de junio (ACNC) -- Jo Hyok Chol y Mun Su Jong de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ganaron medallas de oro en el Campeonato Asiatico de Lucha de Juniores 2015 que se efectua desde el dia 11 en la India bajo la presencia de mas de 290 jugadores de ambos sexos de mas de 20 paises y regiones inclusive la RPDC.
					En la division (m) de 42kg del estilo grecorromano, Jo Hyok Chol gano a su rival japones en las eliminatorias y a su rival de Turkmenistan en el cuarto de final y arrodillo al jugador de Kazajstan en la semifinal y a su rival irani en la final.
					
					En la division (f) de 40kg de lucha, Mun Su Jong gano a sus rivales de Kazajstan, China y Taipei de China y en la final arrodillo a la luchadora de la India.

articles.title: Won Un Gyong, campeona mundial de Boxeo de Juniores y Jovenes 2015
articles.content:
Won Un Gyong, campeona mundial de Boxeo de Juniores y Jovenes 2015
						
Pyongyang, 12 de junio (ACNC) -- La pugilista coreana Won Un Gyong obtuvo la medalla de oro en el Campeonato Mundial de Boxeo de Juniores y Jovenes 2015, efectuado hace poco.
					Won, una de deportistas de poca edad, elimino en la eliminatoria de la division de 46kg a sus rivales mongol y suiza por 3:0 y vencio a la rusa fuerte en la semifinal por 2:1.
					
					Al arrodillar en la final a la turca por 3:0, ella se hizo campeona mundial de Boxeo de Juniores.
					
					Segun Kim Jong Chol, subsecretario general de la Asociacion de Boxeo de Corea, Won participo por primera vez en el presente campeonato.
					
					Nacida en una familia obrera ordinaria, ella se incorporo a 10 anos de edad al sistema estatal de formacion de reserva y aprendio segun su deseo la tecnologia de boxeo.
					
					Ella conquisto en el ano pasado la medalla de oro en la Competencia Deportiva Nacional de las Escuelas Deportivas de Jovenes y Ninos y en la Competencia Nacional de Juniores.
					
					Buena preparacion fisica, movimiento ligero, rapida combinacion de ataque y contraataque y golpe sucesivo son sus meritos.
					
					Won atrae atencion del circulo de boxeo femenino.

articles.title: Equipo coreano vence a su rival de Yemen
articles.content:
Equipo coreano vence a su rival de Yemen
						
Pyongyang, 12 de junio (ACNC) -- Quedo iniciada la segunda etapa de las eliminatorias de la region asiatica para ganar el boleto a la Copa Mundial de la FIFA 2018.
					En la competencia con el once de Yemen efectuada el dia 11 en Qatar, el equipo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea vencio a ese equipo por 1 a 0.
					
					El gol anotado por el jugador So Hyon Uk a eso de 30 minutos del segundo tiempo decidio el triunfo del equipo coreano.
					
					El entrenador-jefe del equipo es Kim Chang Bok. Ri Myong Guk, Pak Kwang Ryong y Ri Yong Jik quienes sobresalieron en 17o Juegos Asiaticos son gruesos del equipo.
					
					El once coreano sostendra el dia 16 el segundo partido con el equipo de Uzbekistan en Pyongyang.
					
					En el grupo H estan integrados los equipos de la RPDC, Bahrein, Uzbekistan, Yemen y Filipinas.
